```{r}
library(readr)
X1_mvars <- read_csv("data/1_mvars.csv")
#View(X1_mvars)
```

```{r}
X1_mvars <- X1_mvars[c(1:100),] #create sample to test more quickly
```


```{r}
dataset_mod <- X1_mvars[5:length(X1_mvars)]
dataset_mod <- subset(x = dataset_mod, select = c(longitude, latitude, price))
#View(dataset_mod)
```

```{r}
library(sf)
library("sp") #needed for coordinate transformation
library("ggplot2")
library("OpenStreetMap")
library("raster") #for borders
library("geoR")

# Convert data frame to sf object
spatial_airbnb_sf <- st_as_sf(x = dataset_mod, 
                        coords = c("longitude", "latitude"),
                        crs = "+proj=utm +zone=32 ellps=WGS84 +units=km") #could be changed to meter

# convert to sp object if needed
spatial_airbnb_sp <- as(spatial_airbnb_sf, "Spatial")
```


```{r}

plot_loc <- data.frame(spatial_airbnb_sp) 
colnames(plot_loc)
colnames(plot_loc)[2] <- "Easting"
colnames(plot_loc)[3] <- "Northing"


# part iii)
ggplot(data = plot_loc, mapping = aes(x = Easting,
                                  y = Northing)) + 
  geom_point(size = 2) +
  labs(title = "Location airbnbs in Berlin", 
       x = "Easting", # Always label your axes.
       y = "Northing") 

# and in degrees..
```

```{r}
dataset_mod["price"] <- log(dataset_mod["price"]) 

berlin_geodata_full <- as.geodata(dataset_mod, 1:2, 3)
# args for geodata:   object which is a table here. 
#                     the columns in the table where the spatial oordinates are
#                     the column where the data is



plot(berlin_geodata_full)
```

```{r}
v <- variog(berlin_geodata_full, max.dist = 1)
library("ggplot2")

plot(v)
```

```{r}
cov_est1 <- likfit(
  geodata = berlin_geodata_full,
  cov.model = "exponential",
  ini.cov.pars = c(1, 1),
  nugget = 0,
  fix.nugget = FALSE,
  messages = TRUE
)

#likfit function to fit spatial model with ordianry kriging
# cov.model: in this class we always assume a exponential cov.model
# ini.cov.pars is the starting value
# nugget is the starting value for the nugget
# fix.nugget is wheather to fix the non-spatial error term. 
# default is the ML so no need to specify the schÃ¤tzer here
summary(cov_est1)

#Two or more pairs of data at coincident (or very close) locations. 
#This may cause crashes in some matrices operations.
```
